categories.heading: AI adoption
categories.description: AI adoption is measured as a factor composed of three highly interrelated variables, reliance, trust, and reflexive use.

questions: In the last 3 months, how much have you relied on AI at work?|Not at all,A little,A moderate amount,A lot,A great deal
In the last 3 months, how much did you trust the quality of AI-generated output at work?|Not at all,A little,Somewhat,A lot,A great deal
In the last 3 months, when you encountered a problem to solve or a task to complete at work, how frequently did you use AI?|Never,Sometimes,About half the time,Most of the time,Always

categories.heading: AI capabilities
categories.description: The seven AI capabilities are shown to amplify the benefits of AI adoption.

question_groups.description: A platform is a set of capabilities that is shared across multiple applications or services. A company may have multiple overlapping platforms, but we refer to these overall as 'the platform'. A platform team is a group of people dedicated to building and running the platform. A dedicated platform team is not required.

questions: In the last 3 months, did you use a platform at work?|I didn't use a platform,I used a platform,I used multiple platforms,I don't know

question_groups.description: To what extent does your platform(s) demonstrate the following characteristics?
question_groups.group_responses: Not at all,Slightly,Moderately,Very much,Extremely,I don't know,Not applicable
questions: The platform provides the tools and information I need to work independently.
The platform helps me follow required processes (e.g., code reviews, security sign-offs).

categories.heading: Outcomes
categories.description: Outcomes represent the goals of professionals on technology-driven teams. We want to understand how outcomes differ when comparing different levels of AI adoption.

question_groups.description: For this survey, your team is the group of people you work with on a day-to-day basis to build, maintain, or support the same application or service. This group may include people who report to a different manager but share your immediate work goals; it's about the shared work, not the org chart.
How would you rate your team's current performance in the following areas?
